toolSpecificData.result:
I now have comprehensive information about the entire project. Here is the full report:

---

# Sky.HubAI ‚Äî Comprehensive Project Analysis

## 1. Solution Structure

**Solution File**: [src/Sky.HubAI.sln](src/Sky.HubAI.sln)

### Solution Folders (Logical Grouping)
| Folder | Layer |
|--------|-------|
| 1. Domain | `Sky.HubAI.Domain` |
| 2. Application | `Sky.HubAI.Application` |
| 3. Infrastructure | `Sky.HubAI.Infrastructure.OpenAI`, `Sky.HubAI.Infrastructure.FileStorage` |
| 4. Presentation | `Sky.HubAI.Api` |
| 5. Tests | (empty ‚Äî no test projects exist) |

### Projects & Dependencies

| Project | Target | NuGet Packages | Project Refs |
|---------|--------|----------------|-------------|
| **Sky.HubAI.Api** | `net8.0` | `Asp.Versioning.Mvc` 8.1.0, `Asp.Versioning.Mvc.ApiExplorer` 8.1.0, `Swashbuckle.AspNetCore` 9.0.3 | Application, Infrastructure.FileStorage, Infrastructure.OpenAI |
| **Sky.HubAI.Application** | `net8.0` | `MediatR` 12.5.0, `FluentValidation` 11.9.0, `FluentValidation.DependencyInjectionExtensions` 11.9.0 | Domain |
| **Sky.HubAI.Domain** | `net8.0` | `Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.Abstractions` 8.0.3 | _(none)_ |
| **Sky.HubAI.Infrastructure.FileStorage** | `net8.0` | `ClosedXML` 0.105.0, `Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Abstractions` 8.0.0, `Microsoft.Extensions.Options.ConfigurationExtensions` 8.0.0 | Application, Domain |
| **Sky.HubAI.Infrastructure.OpenAI** | `net8.0` | `Azure.AI.OpenAI` 2.1.0, `ClosedXML` 0.102.2, `Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Abstractions` 8.0.0, `Microsoft.Extensions.Options.ConfigurationExtensions` 8.0.0 | Application, Domain |

> **Note**: `ImplicitUsings` is **disabled** in all projects except Infrastructure.FileStorage, meaning all `using` statements are explicit.

---

## 2. API Layer (`src/Api/`)

### 2.1 Startup ([Program.cs](src/Api/Program.cs))

Clean layered registration pattern:
1. `builder.AddPresentation()` ‚Äî controllers, Swagger, API versioning, CORS, auth settings, hosted service
2. `builder.Services.AddDomainServices()` ‚Äî domain services
3. `builder.Services.AddApplication()` ‚Äî MediatR + FluentValidation + behaviors
4. `builder.Services.AddFileStorageInfrastructure(config)` ‚Äî file storage services
5. `builder.Services.AddOpenAiInfrastructure(config)` ‚Äî Azure OpenAI services
6. `app.UsePresentation()` ‚Äî middleware pipeline
7. Exposes `partial class Program` for integration tests

### 2.2 Controllers

**Base Controller**: [V1ControllerBase.cs](src/Api/Controllers/V1ControllerBase.cs) ‚Äî abstract, holds `IMediator` + `ILogger<T>`, tagged `[ApiVersion("1.0")]`

| Controller | Route | Endpoints |
|-----------|-------|-----------|
| [BlockedKeywordsController](src/Api/Controllers/V1/BlockedKeywordsController.cs) | `api/v1/blocked-keywords` | `POST` (upload .txt) ‚Üí update list; `GET` ‚Üí retrieve list |
| [DocumentAnalysisController](src/Api/Controllers/V1/DocumentAnalysisController.cs) | `api/v1/document-analysis` | `POST` (multipart: images + metadata) ‚Üí AI document analysis |
| [IntentClassificationsController](src/Api/Controllers/V1/IntentClassificationsController.cs) | `api/v1/intent-classifications` | `POST` (JSON body) ‚Üí AI intent classification |
| [ProductsController](src/Api/Controllers/V1/ProductsController.cs) | `api/v1/products` | `POST` (upload .xlsx) ‚Üí update list; `GET` ‚Üí retrieve list |

### 2.3 Dependency Injection

**[PresentationServiceCollectionExtensions.cs](src/Api/DependencyInjection/PresentationServiceCollectionExtensions.cs)** registers:
- `AuthSettings` from config section `"Auth"`
- Controllers with lowercase kebab-case route transformer + camelCase JSON serialization
- API Versioning (URL segment, header `x-api-version`, query string `api-version`)
- Swagger with `X-Client-Token` API key security scheme
- CORS (AllowAnyOrigin/Header/Method)
- `MemoryCacheWarmupHostedService`
- ProblemDetails + `GlobalExceptionHandlerMiddleware`

**[PresentationApplicationBuilderExtensions.cs](src/Api/DependencyInjection/PresentationApplicationBuilderExtensions.cs)** configures the HTTP pipeline:
1. `CorrelationIdMiddleware`
2. ExceptionHandler
3. ForwardedHeaders (for Azure App Service reverse proxy)
4. HSTS + HTTPS Redirection (non-dev only)
5. Routing
6. CORS
7. `ClientTokenAuthMiddleware`
8. `HttpLoggingMiddleware`
9. Authorization
10. MapControllers

### 2.4 Middleware

| Middleware | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| [CorrelationIdMiddleware](src/Api/Middleware/CorrelationIdMiddleware.cs) | Generates/propagates `X-Correlation-Id` header; stores in `HttpContext.Items` and logging scope |
| [ClientTokenAuthMiddleware](src/Api/Middleware/ClientTokenAuthMiddleware.cs) | Optional API key auth via `X-Client-Token` header; time-constant string comparison; bypasses Swagger/OPTIONS |
| [HttpLoggingMiddleware](src/Api/Middleware/HttpLoggingMiddleware.cs) | Logs full request/response bodies (JSON body or multipart summary); buffers response stream |
| [GlobalExceptionHandlerMiddleware](src/Api/Middleware/GlobalExceptionHandlerMiddleware.cs) | `IExceptionHandler` impl; maps exceptions to RFC 7807 ProblemDetails (see error handling section) |

### 2.5 Contracts

| Feature | Request | Response | Validator |
|---------|---------|----------|-----------|
| **Update Products** | `UpdateProductListRequest` (IFormFile) | `UpdateProductListResponse` (RecordsSkipped/Before/After) | `UpdateProductListRequestValidator` (.xlsx only, max 10MB) |
| **Get Products** | _(none)_ | `GetProductListResponse` (IEnumerable<Product(Code,Name)>) | ‚Äî |
| **Update Blocked Keywords** | `UpdateBlockedKeywordListRequest` (IFormFile) | `UpdateBlockedKeywordListResponse` (RecordsSkipped/Before/After) | `UpdateBlockedKeywordListRequestValidator` (max 5MB) |
| **Get Blocked Keywords** | _(none)_ | `GetBlockedKeywordListResponse` (IEnumerable<string>) | ‚Äî |
| **Document Analysis** | `DocumentAnalysisRequest` (List<IFormFile> Images, FullName, DocumentNumber, BirthDate) | `DocumentAnalysisResponse` (InformedData, ImageData, Similarity dictionaries) | ‚Äî (manual validation in controller) |
| **Intent Classification** | `IntentClassificationsRequest` (Description string) | `IntentClassificationsResponse` (complex: ClassifiedProducts, Action, ProductDescription, ProductCode, Keywords, Log, MatchedProducts, UnmatchedProducts, SearchQueries) | ‚Äî |

### 2.6 Mappings (API Layer)

All in [src/Api/Mappings/](src/Api/Mappings/) ‚Äî hand-written static extension methods (`ToResponse()`, `ToQuery()`) mapping between Application DTOs and API contracts.

### 2.7 Other

- [AuthSettings](src/Api/Settings/AuthSettings.cs) ‚Äî `EnableClientToken` (bool), `ClientToken` (string)
- [LowercaseRouteTransformer](src/Api/Routing/LowercaseRouteTransformer.cs) ‚Äî converts PascalCase controller names to kebab-case URLs
- [MemoryCacheWarmupHostedService](src/Api/HostedService/MemoryCacheWarmupHostedService.cs) ‚Äî on startup calls `IProductMemoryCacheService.ReloadProductsAsync()` to pre-warm the cache

---

## 3. Application Layer (`src/Application/`)

### 3.1 Dependency Injection ([ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs](src/Application/DependencyInjection/ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs))

Registers:
- MediatR from assembly (auto-discovers handlers)
- `ValidationBehavior<,>` as open behavior
- `RequestResponseLoggingBehavior<,>` as transient pipeline behavior
- All FluentValidation validators from assembly

### 3.2 Abstractions (Interfaces)

| Interface | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| `IFileStorageImporterService` | Import products from Excel stream; import blocked keywords from text stream |
| `IIntentExcelReaderService` | Read descriptions from Excel for batch intent processing |
| `IOpenAiDocumentAnalysisService` | Analyze document images via Azure OpenAI Vision |
| `IOpenAiIntentClassifyService` | Classify intent via Azure OpenAI with function calling |
| `IProductMemoryCacheService` | In-memory product/keyword cache: reload, get all, count |

### 3.3 Use Cases (CQRS via MediatR)

**Product Domain:**

| Use Case | Type | File | Handler Logic |
|----------|------|------|---------------|
| `UpdateProductListCommand` | Command | [UpdateProductListCommand.cs](src/Application/UseCases/Product/UpdateProductList/UpdateProductListCommand.cs) | Imports Excel ‚Üí CSV via `IFileStorageImporterService`, reloads cache, returns counts |
| `GetProductListQuery` | Query | [GetProductListQuery.cs](src/Application/UseCases/Product/GetProductList/GetProductListQuery.cs) | Reads from `IProductMemoryCacheService`, maps to DTOs |

**Blocked Keywords Domain:**

| Use Case | Type | Handler Logic |
|----------|------|---------------|
| `UpdateBlockedKeywordListCommand` | Command | Imports text file via `IFileStorageImporterService`, reloads cache, returns counts |
| `GetBlockedKeywordListQuery` | Query | Reads from `IProductMemoryCacheService.GetAllBlockedKeywords()` |

**Document Domain:**

| Use Case | Type | Handler Logic |
|----------|------|---------------|
| `AnalyzeDocumentQuery` | Query | Sends images to `IOpenAiDocumentAnalysisService`, then compares extracted data vs. informed data via `IDocumentDataComparisonService` |

**Intent Domain:**

| Use Case | Type | Handler Logic |
|----------|------|---------------|
| `ClassifyIntentQuery` | Query | Orchestrates: loads products from cache ‚Üí creates local `SearchProducts` function ‚Üí calls `IOpenAiIntentClassifyService.ClassifyIntentAsync` with function calling ‚Üí normalizes action names (`product-add`, `product-remove`, `none`) |

### 3.4 Validators (FluentValidation)

- `UpdateProductListCommandValidator` ‚Äî requires non-null, non-empty stream
- `UpdateBlockedKeywordListCommandValidator` ‚Äî requires non-null, non-empty stream, max 5MB, detects binary files via magic bytes (ZIP, XLSX, PDF, PNG, JPEG, GIF)
- `ClassifyIntentQueryValidator` ‚Äî requires non-empty description, max 5000 chars

### 3.5 Behaviors (MediatR Pipeline)

| Behavior | Purpose |
|----------|---------|
| [ValidationBehavior<TRequest,TResponse>](src/Application/Behaviors/ValidationBehavior.cs) | Runs all registered `IValidator<TRequest>` validators; throws `FluentValidation.ValidationException` on failure |
| [RequestResponseLoggingBehavior<TRequest,TResponse>](src/Application/Behaviors/RequestResponseLoggingBehavior.cs) | Logs request/response with `ILogger` for every MediatR handler |

### 3.6 Models

- `ImportResultServiceModel(ImportedCount, SkippedCount)` ‚Äî shared import result
- `IntentClassificationResult` ‚Äî rich model with `ClassifiedProducts`, `Keywords`, `Log`, `PossibleProducts`, `MatchedProducts`, `UnmatchedProducts`, `SearchQueries` (including sub-records `ClassifiedProduct`, `ProductCandidate`, `ProductSearchQuery`)

### 3.7 Mappings (Application Layer)

Hand-written extension methods in [src/Application/Mappings/](src/Application/Mappings/):
- `ProductMappingExtensions.ToResult()` ‚Äî `IReadOnlyList<Product>` ‚Üí `IEnumerable<ProductDTO>`
- `DocumentMappingExtensions.ToResult()` ‚Äî `DocumentAnalysis` ‚Üí `AnalyzeDocumentResult`
- `BlockedKeywordMappingExtensions.ToResult()` ‚Äî `IReadOnlyList<string>` ‚Üí `IEnumerable<BlockedKeywordDTO>`

---

## 4. Domain Layer (`src/Domain/`)

### 4.1 Entities

| Entity | File | Properties |
|--------|------|------------|
| `Product` | [Product.cs](src/Domain/Entities/Product.cs) | `Code`, `Name` (primary constructor, private setters) |
| `ProductMatchResult` | [Product.cs](src/Domain/Entities/Product.cs) | `Product`, `MatchPercentage` (score √ó 100, rounded) |
| `Document` | [Document.cs](src/Domain/Entities/Document.cs) | `ClientFullName`, `ClientDocumentNumber`, `ClientBirthDate`, `DocumentImages` (List<byte[]>) |
| `DocumentAnalysis` | [DocumentAnalysis.cs](src/Domain/Entities/DocumentAnalysis.cs) | `InformedData`, `ImageData`, `Similarity` (Dictionary maps) |

### 4.2 Domain Services

| Service | Interface | Purpose |
|---------|-----------|---------|
| `ProductMatchingService` | `IProductMatchingService` | Fuzzy product matching: tokenization (diacritic removal, split by separators), word compatibility scoring (`matchCount/wordCount`), Levenshtein distance (available but not used in primary flow), returns top N matches |
| `DocumentDataComparisonService` | `IDocumentDataComparisonService` | Compares informed vs. extracted document data using Levenshtein-based string similarity; produces per-field confidence % and `similarityTotal` |

### 4.3 Exceptions

| Exception | Error Code | Factory Methods |
|-----------|------------|----------------|
| `DomainException` (abstract base) | configurable | ‚Äî |
| `ProductImportException` | `PRODUCT_IMPORT_ERROR` | `NoValidRecords()`, `InvalidFormat()`, `ProcessingFailed()` |
| `BlockedKeywordImportException` | `BLOCKED_KEYWORD_IMPORT_ERROR` | `NoValidRecords()`, `InvalidFormat()`, `ProcessingFailed()` |

### 4.4 Dependency Injection ([ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs](src/Domain/DependencyInjection/ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs))

Registers both domain services as **Scoped**:
- `IDocumentDataComparisonService` ‚Üí `DocumentDataComparisonService`
- `IProductMatchingService` ‚Üí `ProductMatchingService`

---

## 5. Infrastructure Layers

### 5.1 Infrastructure.FileStorage

**DI** ([ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs](src/Infrastructure.FileStorage/DependencyInjection/ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs)): All registered as **Singleton**:
- `FileStorageSettings` from config section `"FileStorage"`
- `IFileStorageImporterService` ‚Üí `FileStorageImporterService`
- `IProductMemoryCacheService` ‚Üí `ProductMemoryCacheService`
- `IIntentExcelReaderService` ‚Üí `IntentExcelReaderService`

**Settings** ([FileStorageSettings.cs](src/Infrastructure.FileStorage/Settings/FileStorageSettings.cs)):
- `ProductCsvPath` ‚Äî path to products CSV file
- `BlockedKeywordsPath` ‚Äî path to blocked keywords text file

**Services:**

| Service | Responsibility |
|---------|---------------|
| [ProductMemoryCacheService](src/Infrastructure.FileStorage/Services/ProductMemoryCacheService.cs) | Singleton in-memory cache for products (Dictionary<string,Product>) and blocked keywords (List<string>). Loads from CSV/TXT files with retry logic (exponential backoff, 5 attempts). Filters products against blocked keywords using regex word-boundary matching. Thread-safe via `Volatile.Read/Write`. |
| [FileStorageImporterService](src/Infrastructure.FileStorage/Services/FileStorageImporterService.cs) | Imports products from Excel (.xlsx) via ClosedXML: reads PROD_CD/PROD_DESC columns, filters by STATUS_CD=Active and CATEGORY_CD‚â†Faturavel, writes atomic CSV replacement. Imports blocked keywords from text file similarly. Uses temp file + atomic `File.Move` with retry. |
| [IntentExcelReaderService](src/Infrastructure.FileStorage/Services/IntentExcelReaderService.cs) | Reads description texts from Excel column A for batch intent classification |
| [CsvConstants](src/Infrastructure.FileStorage/Services/CsvConstants.cs) | Defines CSV delimiter (`,`) and header names (`Code`, `Name`) |

### 5.2 Infrastructure.OpenAI

**DI** ([ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs](src/Infrastructure.OpenAI/DependencyInjection/ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs)): Registered as **Singleton**:
- `AzureOpenAiSettings` from config section `"AzureOpenAI"`
- `IOpenAiIntentClassifyService` ‚Üí `OpenAiIntentClassifyService`
- `IOpenAiDocumentAnalysisService` ‚Üí `OpenAiDocumentAnalysisService`

## 6. Patterns & Conventions

### Architecture
- **Clean Architecture** (4-layer): Domain ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Infrastructure ‚Üí Presentation
- **CQRS** via MediatR: Commands (mutations) and Queries (reads) with separate handler classes
- **Mediator Pattern**: All controller actions dispatch via `IMediator.Send()`
- **DI by layer**: Each layer exposes a single extension method for registration

### Naming Conventions
- **Namespaces**: `Sky.HubAI.{Layer}.{Feature}` (e.g., `Sky.HubAI.Application.UseCases.Product.UpdateProductList`)
- **Use Case structure**: `{Feature}/{Action}/{Action}Command|Query.cs`, `{Action}CommandHandler.cs`, `{Action}Result.cs`, `{Action}CommandValidator.cs`
- **Files in English**, chat/log messages in **Portuguese (Brazilian)**
- **Records** for immutable DTOs and commands/queries
- **Extension methods** for mappings (`.ToResponse()`, `.ToResult()`, `.ToQuery()`)

### Validation
- **Two-tier validation**:
  1. **API-level** (Contracts): HTTP concerns (file type, size) via FluentValidation validators on request DTOs
  2. **Application-level** (UseCases): Business rules (stream validity, content type detection) via FluentValidation validators on commands/queries
  3. `ValidationBehavior<,>` pipeline behavior throws `FluentValidation.ValidationException`
- `DocumentAnalysisController` uses **manual validation** (not FluentValidation)

### Error Handling
- **GlobalExceptionHandlerMiddleware** (`IExceptionHandler`) maps exceptions to RFC 7807 ProblemDetails:
  - `ProductImportException` ‚Üí 400 with error code
  - `FluentValidation.ValidationException` ‚Üí 400 with grouped field errors
  - `DomainException` ‚Üí 400 with error code
  - `InvalidOperationException`, `ArgumentException`, `IOException`, `UnauthorizedAccessException`, `NotSupportedException` ‚Üí 400
  - All others ‚Üí 500
- Correlation ID injected into ProblemDetails extensions

### Dependency Injection Lifetimes
| Layer | Lifetime |
|-------|----------|
| Domain Services | Scoped |
| Application (MediatR, Validators) | Transient (MediatR default) |
| Infrastructure.FileStorage | **Singleton** (cache, file importers) |
| Infrastructure.OpenAI | **Singleton** (OpenAI clients) |

---

## 7. External Integrations

### Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o)
- **Endpoint**: Azure-hosted (`sk-sky-hubai.openai.azure.com`)
- **Model**: `gpt-4o` deployment
- **Features used**:
  - **Chat completions** with system/user messages
  - **Vision** (image analysis via `ChatMessageContentPart.CreateImagePart`)
  - **Function Calling / Tool Use** (`search_products` tool for dynamic product catalog search)
- **Config**: `MinMatchPercentage` = 85% threshold for product matching

### File Storage (Local CSV/TXT)
- Products stored in **CSV** (`products.csv`) ‚Äî converted from uploaded Excel
- Blocked keywords stored in **TXT** (`blocked_keywords.txt`)
- Atomic file replacement pattern (temp file ‚Üí `File.Move` with retry)

### Caching Strategy
- **In-memory singleton** (`ProductMemoryCacheService`) ‚Äî Dictionary<string,Product> + List<string>
- **Thread-safe** via `Volatile.Read/Write`
- **Warm-up** on startup via `MemoryCacheWarmupHostedService`
- **Reload** triggered by update endpoints (POST products/blocked-keywords)
- Products filtered at read-time against blocked keywords using regex word-boundary matching
- Retry with exponential backoff (5 attempts) for file I/O

### Authentication
- Custom `X-Client-Token` header-based auth (optional, configurable via `Auth:EnableClientToken`)
- Time-constant string comparison to prevent timing attacks

### Hosting Environment
- **Azure App Service** (HML: `sky-hubai-hml-*.brazilsouth-01.azurewebsites.net`)
- Forward proxy headers support configured
- HTTPS + HSTS in non-development environments

## Summary

**Sky.HubAI** is a .NET 8 Clean Architecture API providing three AI-powered capabilities for a Brazilian/Uruguayan pay-TV operation (Sky):

1. **Intent Classification** ‚Äî Classifies customer service text descriptions into product add/remove actions using Azure OpenAI GPT-4o with function calling for dynamic product catalog search
2. **Document Analysis** ‚Äî Extracts and validates identity document data from images using GPT-4o Vision, comparing against informed client data with Levenshtein similarity
3. **Product & Blocked Keyword Management** ‚Äî CRUD for product catalogs (Excel‚ÜíCSV) and blocked keyword lists (TXT), with in-memory caching and filtered product retrieval

## 6. Patterns & Conventions

### Architecture
- **Clean Architecture** (4-layer): Domain ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Infrastructure ‚Üí Presentation
- **CQRS** via MediatR: Commands (mutations) and Queries (reads) with separate handler classes
- **Mediator Pattern**: All controller actions dispatch via `IMediator.Send()`
- **DI by layer**: Each layer exposes a single extension method for registration

### Naming Conventions
- **Namespaces**: `Sky.HubAI.{Layer}.{Feature}` (e.g., `Sky.HubAI.Application.UseCases.Product.UpdateProductList`)
- **Use Case structure**: `{Feature}/{Action}/{Action}Command|Query.cs`, `{Action}CommandHandler.cs`, `{Action}Result.cs`, `{Action}CommandValidator.cs`
- **Files in English**, chat/log messages in **Portuguese (Brazilian)**
- **Records** for immutable DTOs and commands/queries
- **Extension methods** for mappings (`.ToResponse()`, `.ToResult()`, `.ToQuery()`)

### Validation
- **Two-tier validation**:
  1. **API-level** (Contracts): HTTP concerns (file type, size) via FluentValidation validators on request DTOs
  2. **Application-level** (UseCases): Business rules (stream validity, content type detection) via FluentValidation validators on commands/queries
  3. `ValidationBehavior<,>` pipeline behavior throws `FluentValidation.ValidationException`
- `DocumentAnalysisController` uses **manual validation** (not FluentValidation)

### Error Handling
- **GlobalExceptionHandlerMiddleware** (`IExceptionHandler`) maps exceptions to RFC 7807 ProblemDetails:
  - `ProductImportException` ‚Üí 400 with error code
  - `FluentValidation.ValidationException` ‚Üí 400 with grouped field errors
  - `DomainException` ‚Üí 400 with error code
  - `InvalidOperationException`, `ArgumentException`, `IOException`, `UnauthorizedAccessException`, `NotSupportedException` ‚Üí 400
  - All others ‚Üí 500
- Correlation ID injected into ProblemDetails extensions

### Dependency Injection Lifetimes
| Layer | Lifetime |
|-------|----------|
| Domain Services | Scoped |
| Application (MediatR, Validators) | Transient (MediatR default) |
| Infrastructure.FileStorage | **Singleton** (cache, file importers) |
| Infrastructure.OpenAI | **Singleton** (OpenAI clients) |

---

## 7. External Integrations

### Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o)
- **Endpoint**: Azure-hosted (`sk-sky-hubai.openai.azure.com`)
- **Model**: `gpt-4o` deployment
- **Features used**:
  - **Chat completions** with system/user messages
  - **Vision** (image analysis via `ChatMessageContentPart.CreateImagePart`)
  - **Function Calling / Tool Use** (`search_products` tool for dynamic product catalog search)
- **Config**: `MinMatchPercentage` = 85% threshold for product matching

### File Storage (Local CSV/TXT)
- Products stored in **CSV** (`products.csv`) ‚Äî converted from uploaded Excel
- Blocked keywords stored in **TXT** (`blocked_keywords.txt`)
- Atomic file replacement pattern (temp file ‚Üí `File.Move` with retry)

### Caching Strategy
- **In-memory singleton** (`ProductMemoryCacheService`) ‚Äî Dictionary<string,Product> + List<string>
- **Thread-safe** via `Volatile.Read/Write`
- **Warm-up** on startup via `MemoryCacheWarmupHostedService`
- **Reload** triggered by update endpoints (POST products/blocked-keywords)
- Products filtered at read-time against blocked keywords using regex word-boundary matching
- Retry with exponential backoff (5 attempts) for file I/O

### Authentication
- Custom `X-Client-Token` header-based auth (optional, configurable via `Auth:EnableClientToken`)
- Time-constant string comparison to prevent timing attacks

### Hosting Environment
- **Azure App Service** (HML: `sky-hubai-hml-*.brazilsouth-01.azurewebsites.net`)
- Forward proxy headers support configured
- HTTPS + HSTS in non-development environments

## Summary

**Sky.HubAI** is a .NET 8 Clean Architecture API providing three AI-powered capabilities for a Brazilian/Uruguayan pay-TV operation (Sky):

1. **Intent Classification** ‚Äî Classifies customer service text descriptions into product add/remove actions using Azure OpenAI GPT-4o with function calling for dynamic product catalog search
2. **Document Analysis** ‚Äî Extracts and validates identity document data from images using GPT-4o Vision, comparing against informed client data with Levenshtein similarity
3. **Product & Blocked Keyword Management** ‚Äî CRUD for product catalogs (Excel‚ÜíCSV) and blocked keyword lists (TXT), with in-memory caching and filtered product retrieval

**Clean Architecture** com **CQRS** (Command Query Responsibility Segregation) via MediatR.

## Projetos e Depend√™ncias

```
Sky.HubAI.sln
```

### Regras de Depend√™ncia

- **Domain** n√£o depende de nenhuma outra camada

## Camadas

| Camada | Projeto | Responsabilidade |

|--------|----------|--------|
| Domain Services | **Scoped** | Stateless, per-request |
| Application (MediatR, Validators) | **Transient** | MediatR default |

### Registration Pattern

Cada camada exp√µe **uma extension method** em `DependencyInjection/ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs`:

```csharp
// Program.cs
```

| Tipo | Prop√≥sito | Naming |
|------|-----------|--------|
| **Command** | Opera√ß√µes de escrita (mutations) | `{Action}Command` + `{Action}CommandHandler` |

### Pipeline Behaviors (MediatR)

Executados em ordem para **todo** request MediatR:

| 1 | `ValidationBehavior<TRequest, TResponse>` | Executa todos os `IValidator<TRequest>` registrados; lan√ßa `ValidationException` em falha |

Todas as exce√ß√µes s√£o convertidas em **RFC 7807 ProblemDetails**:

| `UnauthorizedAccessException`, `NotSupportedException` | 400 | ‚Äî |
| Qualquer outra | 500 | Internal Server Error |

## Middleware Stack (ordem de execu√ß√£o)

```
1. CorrelationIdMiddleware          ‚Üí gera/propaga X-Correlation-Id
```

## Mappings

Convers√£o entre camadas via **extension methods est√°ticos** (sem AutoMapper):

| Camada | M√©todo | Dire√ß√£o |
|--------|--------|---------|
| API | `.ToResponse()` | Application Result ‚Üí API Response |

### Tipo de Documento
